body:
I will update the client to the latest.

[https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GORA-515](url)
I have sent the PR on the aerospike client update. Thanks a lot @djkevincr for merging to the master. Thanks a lot to the great the support given. :)
Merged the PR. Thanks @nishadi

Hi @madhawa-gunasekara , 
Sorry for the late reply, but to handle that case why don't just do the mapping manually as we currently do and only serialize differently? So what I had in mind was using our own same old avro java bean for keeping things in-memory, but when pushing this into Cassandra, then (1) store everything as avro binary data (serialize every type as binary data as we did), or (2) use cassandra native serialization so users can use regular CQL for checking their data. 
You accomplished the same :) BUT now we have also introduced a different in-memory data bean which will not help in keeping a single entry-point for all no-sql databases (now we need Cassandra java beans).  I think we could just go back to use our own avro data beans and use the native serialization you have coded, and then later handling the avro binary serialization. What do you think? how much work would it be?
@oscerd This is great. Will locally test the PR and merge to the master. Thanks for the contribution :)
@madhawa-gunasekara what is the status of this PR?
@oscerd I have merged your PR. Looking forward to your future contributions :)
I'm glad to help, I'll try to contribute more.
@nishadi PR looks good. Will let some time allowing others to take a look.
Thanks :)
@nishadi PR looks good. I think we can omit the test cases for now as per the explanation.

@nishadi Merged the PR.
@nishadi PR is merged. Thanks for the PR.
Merged the PR. Thanks @nishadi :)
I am currently working on this. Please don't merge it.
@nishadi Merged the PR. This is great :)
Will locally test and merge this.
@nishadi Merged the PR. Thanks this is nice :)
Hi @madhawa-gunasekara what is the status of this PR now? Thank you
Hi @lewismc  It's complete.
@madhawa-gunasekara great, I am testing it and will commit to master once all tests pass.
Hi @madhawa-gunasekara you have not addressed all of my comments on the PR... please look over my comments, thank you.

Thank you @madhawa-gunasekara I've merged this alongside a bunch of other documentation such that we can move on with stabilizing Javadoc generation. There is still some more work to do, I will keep working on this.
Hi @djkevincr I would like to move towards pushing a release candidate for Gora 0.8 soon. Having this module included in the release would be excellent.

@lewismc I will merge this changes within today best case or it will be end of tomorrow. Sorry about the delays. Hope that's fine with you. We need to get this thing to the release and that would be great. :)

ack

> Sorry about the delays. 

absolutely no problems at all... the patch looks very good.
@lewismc please give me bit of time working on this.
@lewismc this is merged now. You may proceed pushing a release candidate for Gora 0.8. :)

+1
This is a trivial change so no need for a Jira issue.

Hi @madhawa-gunasekara can you please open a JIRA issue for this and then reference it here?
Thank you

Hi @lewismc 
Please find the JIRA issue for this. 
[1] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GORA-526
Any comments folks?

I tried locally too and can't reproduce the error. All tests pass.

I found this about your error: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-8220
Seems related to OSX and JDK8. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32508530/cassandra-on-mac-stopping-cassandra-shows-error

I guess it can be committed safely :)
Fix for GORA-421 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GORA-421
Any test?

For once I assumed it was too trivial for a test... ;)

I am working on it.

I noticed that maybe someone sometime would need a "setDirty" that sets dirty recursively deep in the hierarchical data, and not only the shallow fields. But this is not the issue :)
Updated with the test :) Thanks for the feedback.
+1 LGTM
nice one @lewismc ! can I ask how you spotted this?
I literally was just looking through the code and saw the comment. I then went over to the Avro source and basically undertook a diff of the Class and methods.
thanks @lewismc
@alfonsonishikawa Thanks for doing this!

Updated the pull request with a fix for a little bug I introduced. AccumuloStore#deleteSchema() was failing when the table did not exist. Not does not fail.

Thanks in advance for reviewing the datastore/s you know :)
I @alfonsonishikawa I think we should go ahead and merge this into master branch. It been sitting for long enough. +1

Hi @alfonsonishikawa , thanks for doing this!
I think the first option was also ok because one thing is logging what the problem was and other throwing the exception for the application using Gora to deal with it as it fits better to the application.
what do you think @lewismc ?

Hey @lewismc 
This looks awesome! Thanks a lot for doing this! I went over the code quickly and I left some questions and nitpicks, feel free to update whenever you have time and ping me back if you want another round of reviews.
Thanks @renato2099 where are the comments? I don't see them.
sorry @lewismc I didn't submitted, I just did now.
@alfonsonishikawa @renato2099 I think this looks good. Tidies up Exception handling quite nicely.

I am +1 for committing this. @carlosrmng it would be great if we could add tests to [DataStoreTestBase.java](https://github.com/apache/gora/blob/master/gora-core/src/test/java/org/apache/gora/store/DataStoreTestBase.java) to accommodate this proposed addition to the core API.
This is great work...!!! As Lewis mentioned, shall we add tests for this? As well we will need to document all the public APIs as well.

Yep tests would be great. IMHO, as this is something we want to test for every Datastore, I suggest it be implemented within [DataStoreTestUtil.java](https://github.com/apache/gora/blob/master/gora-core/src/test/java/org/apache/gora/store/DataStoreTestUtil.java)
Thanks for your support, I will start working in some tests and documentation.
@alfonsonishikawa can you commit to master?
Done, thank you!

I can't believe how sausage-fingers I must be. I left a strange Eclipse autoimport at https://github.com/apache/gora/blob/master/gora-core/src/main/java/org/apache/gora/persistency/impl/BeanFactoryImpl.java#L28 . If you don't mind, I will straight delete it, test and push without a pull request -it is not being used, safe-. How embarrassing. Sorry.

Hi Carlos, This is great. One thing to note is when sending PRs please make sure code is well formatted and all required Java docs are added for public methods. These improvements will show a good standard in your coding :)
+1, can someone merge into master?
Is this okay for merge?
If any one have concerns please raise, otherwise I will proceed merging this PR to master.
This looks good :) Thanks for the PR Carlos. Will keep other s to review as well. If no one have concerns, I will proceed merging this to the master.

Hi @lewismc
I found multiple classes and interfaces that define their own newInstance() method which are not directly affected by the issue. I used my IDE's 'find usages' feature to search for all the Class#newInstance() references within the code, so hopefully I didn't miss anything.

Some examples:
- [javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory#newInstance()](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/xml/parsers/DocumentBuilderFactory.html#newInstance())
- [org.apache.gora.persistency.Persistent#newInstance()](https://github.com/apache/gora/blob/dc70b14b542830cee434329cabee1b801ad51254/gora-core/src/main/java/org/apache/gora/persistency/Persistent.java#L115)
- [org.apache.gora.goraci.generated.CINode#newInstance()](https://github.com/apache/gora/blob/dc70b14b542830cee434329cabee1b801ad51254/gora-goraci/src/main/java/org/apache/gora/goraci/generated/CINode.java#L342)
+1 @djkevincr please merge

I just merged your PR to master. Awesome work Carlos :+1: One minor thing to point out, it s good if you can be consistent with commit messages. Have a look at this post. 
[1] https://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/
@carlosrmng As we discussed offline, Can you please update the PR?

Overall PR looks great Carloz :+1: I will go through PR in detail.

Hi @lewismc @nishadi @alfonsonishikawa 
Thanks for your feedback I will start working on the issues.
@carlosrmng This is excellent work Carlos. Thank you for all hard work you have put into this in summer. I hope you enjoyed your work. Please do address my comments, Let's get this thing merged. :)
@djkevincr @carlosrmng is this ready to merge?
@lewismc I will have a look Lewis. Sorry about the delays. If it s all fine i will proceed merging to master.

np @djkevincr I just wanted to make sure we got it there as well :)
Excellent job on this one folks.. really.
Tested locally and everything passes @alfonsonishikawa any comments?

Hi!

Will try to test it this weekend or maybe between this and next :S
I am deploying my server in my new flat and I have to install a
Goraexplorer VM (can't export directly from Amazon to VirtualBox).

Thanks for the bell ding :)

Regards,

Alfonso

@lewismc Yes implementation really simple, since Flink has this Hadoop Input format wrappers so we can reuse the Gora Input formats directly as data sources and sinks to Apache Flink jobs. I will write common common test code similar to what we have on MapReduceTestUtils so that people write test cases based on Flink Jobs. Documentation will follow.
@alfonsonishikawa Kind reminder on this :) Have you got some time look into this?

Hi, Kevin.

I have to whip myself :( I installed a new VM to install Hbase 2.1.1,
installed it, updated some dependencies in goraexplorer to test it in a
real scenario, and overwhelmingly runned out of time because of my new job
:(

Tests passes allright, though.

Please, pull it. I will complain to myself If something does not work at
Goraexplorer later.

Thank you very much, and so sorry for the delay :(

Alfonso

Tested it (at www.goraexplorer.com) against a HBase 2.1.1 installation and looks good for me.
Sorry for the huge delay :(

Thanks to you for the patch!! :)
